intro: Coccoloba confusa, commonly known as the rock海岛 spinach, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, typically growing in coastal areas and rocky soils. The plant is characterized by its alternate, palmate leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in racemes, and it is often used in local cuisines as a leaf vegetable. The plant is well adapted to saline and windy environments, making it a resilient species in its native range.
